5242746C676E4C038D28591488A99E6C.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

A1D98529851144FBBA016B8E078F6141.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

6E95A033BDF447338791458C1E16B3A5.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

5961F95025A54164AC2C05544647D81F.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

8BCA1F746F45453DA0B53EEE6B7ABC41.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

E7E0B0560DEC46AE8CCE9A102BAE10E0.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

032AB1718CA447DFB32DA1E2ADD70F66.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

A85D30A9C7014DC9B3079798746D6262.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

D531F1E3EB7A45D0920618288074AD79.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

A3EA5E2BD13243F6B6520833C9868B23.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

EC43367E50CF4F50A8E20BDE441B974A.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

BA9DDC09AA0D4B38A9F1AE4D3E22DD86.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

2FDC7DF23C47417B8D02048C78F4EB5C.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

85568B43422442DAAA42ECA1FF3B1D5F.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

FC59A3502AAC4A8597666142D9420313.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

A6B7D2FB43A24A6CBA91667F99F2D0ED.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

263EC0214596485988A170CFCC0CEA05.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

0916CFE236974C09A49FD9463E4CABCB.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

80216C62EABB4EDAB2FBE2C367D9D5D8.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

1E4F903274B04DDAA0D08EA2C3AA2EFA.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

8C133686D7764B73930B36BEE648D3CC.description: Research Saskatchewan post-secondary programs and organizations that provide supports (e.g., grants, professional development, networking opportunities) for theatre professionals within the arts and cultural sector.

6667B24321904EB1BFD8CD49292983C3.description: Reflect on personal interests and analyze potential suitability or non- suitability for various theatre arts occupations.

895C0F3F56D5491BA6BA9F66B08B56FD.description: Examine entrepreneurial opportunities in technical theatre within the community.

34559D49D6F3484DAC6F9508F269F495.description: Examine career opportunities (e.g., costume, lighting, sound, makeup and hair, properties, scenic design) in Saskatchewan theatres and in non- theatre contexts (e.g., event planning, corporate presentations, weddings, awards ceremonies, fashion shows).

E76B16A845144694A291268252228EA0.description: Identify and research a variety of technical theatre arts occupations using criteria such as:different departments (e.g., scenic, costume, Front of House, lighting, sound) involved in productions; educational requirements for various roles (e.g., designers, technicians, stage managers); working conditions, typical hours, locations, permanent versus seasonal or project work; duties and skills required; physical, mental and emotional stresses; other occupations with which they interact; professional and/or licensing requirements; and, anticipated remuneration (e.g., for full- or part-time theatre employees, self-employed, independent projects, collective artist- run organizations).

F00E776167D04EE3917A9789C87222E6.description: Investigate theatre arts career opportunities in Saskatchewan.

0378A4A357C14C62B362B8F5C18532A3.description: Reflect on the enjoyment, fulfilment and challenges derived from interacting with others and from the creative process of working on a production.

4B7722E37D5A49D28046AEDB79EFE3D5.description: Discuss new learning and identify problems, surprises or challenges that arose in the production and how they were resolved.

DA372C938BF2457BBD811415458893A5.description: Reflect on what was accomplished and assess personal growth resulting from theatrical production project work.

425ACD5CAF2A4C2AB63922E07B187AB9.description: Conduct a post-production review of practical experiences (e.g., discuss one’s theatre log and other documentation).

57C16A1CEA0E44E2AEAD9B75B12BF775.description: Contribute to a post- production review of theatre arts experiences.

A315A1FA3D6A419381834127FABF03D3.description: Reflect on own work, including successes and opportunities for improvement, during planning, production and post-production review.

313E51C8F34D4ED586634DE4D801C9F8.description: Examine and analyze decisions made by various roles (e.g., director, actor, designers) to achieve intent.

1D73EA2B418946B7A6B310ADAE561D11.description: Demonstrate problem-solving abilities during planning and production.

A81D56B6C8B54B8890BE21D4BA981964.description: Carry out tasks effectively, efficiently and safely.

5E6BE2AC0CD04052B135709C13E7BB4F.description: Practise communication and collaborative skills required of the production role.

3B7E5E8D801A4C0986F2851170A0BFB6.description: Review the roles and responsibilities of various department heads, co- ordinators and team members to determine how one might provide support in a specific role or department.

51F3682F08D2423E81C42A53965353F2.description: Assume responsibility for one or more team member roles in a theatrical production project.

03228724936D44F1864A44D17579B9EE.description: Assume responsibility for one or more team member roles in a theatrical production project.

B7EDA633F0DC4AA8AD7D6E5B65FB4C64.description: Take responsibility for specific tasks in the planning of a theatre project.

045B81E40C984F1983A19D6CD22AC596.description: Brainstorm ways to prepare for working in a theatrical production (e.g., in preparation for the show or crewing the actual show, keeping a log of hands-on work).

15A30BF525794A20B9762ED21944C85F.description: Collaborate with peers to create student guidelines in preparation for a production.

476FC8882F904549908A9A2E3742BC1E.description: Determine personal interests, experiences and other factors that may affect how one could contribute to a theatrical production project.

46D112CA65F146398F997915E7213979.description: Analyze personal suitability for one or more team member roles in a theatrical production.

E0C22475AF4B4B9B827949EBF6FF6F56.description: Analyze the audience’s experience and how one’s work was an integral part of the whole theatrical event.

C1492C39A25E470AA19C83124772EBAD.description: Reflect on what was achieved and the factors that contributed to one’s learning.

4709F6936E33460A955A4C504C910490.description: Discuss problems, surprises or challenges that could arise, or did arise, in the production and how these challenges could be, or were, resolved.

59A6180F5FA243688E605A804C6C2893.description: Practise safety and collaborative skills when assisting with backstage tasks.

B8ACD49EDAAD492A89341DE7D8BB5B6B.description: Function as a responsible and useful crew member in a stage production.

A795B183821C41EFBCF0BEEF74C78B67.description: Investigate ways to prepare for working in a theatrical production (e.g., in preparation for the show or crewing the actual show, keeping a log of hands-on work).

B222AF08939E44C8B298CCFF13A54CDB.description: Collaborate with peers to create student guidelines in preparation for working in a production.

A3765E8D82374F2EBA0C9EA54F26AD4B.description: Analyze personal interests, experiences and other factors that may determine how one could contribute to a production project in school or community theatre.

5E8658146B7B448C86B4F33C578A2044.description: Assist with backstage tasks for a school or community theatre production project.

FC91D87AE6BB4BC59B395278BCE003C6.description: Reflect on challenges and successes encountered in creating the publicity materials and their impact.

7863F05106774C92987E7EC2E949D05D.description: Create different types of publicity for a real or imagined production. Publicity may include: material for a school or local newspaper or newsletter  internet-based publicity (e.g., webpage, social media video); a print or digital ad, flyer or postcard; a podcast (e.g., talking to cast and production team members about the show); cast trading cards; or, a press release, poster or yard sign.

D8D268418C6F44218582C9405BE70153.description: Critique examples of publicity materials for a variety of theatre productions.

E829766D7F3B487DA9607A172A8C96AA.description: Discuss the function of theatre publicists such as: handling promotion for an individual show; creating ads and materials for print and electronic media; preparing news release; and, designing and creating posters.

279979429C554475B82BE6BFB1AEEC3B.description: Discuss the function of a theatre marketing director and team such as: identifying needs of a customer target market; researching competition (e.g., ticket prices, promotions); developing long- and short-term advertising strategy;designing season brochure and calendar; handling media relations; and, establishing partnerships with organizations and individuals (e.g., media companies, photographers, media personalities).

25B38347233449C1AAFC0DB8E72415D9.description: Create publicity materials for a theatrical production, real or imagined.

E53623607AAB434890DA1886CF295766.description: Communicate clearly with production team members.

715AEFC5C14840D28B15AFB9EAFEF1C2.description: Identify, record and manage the properties list of at least 10 items for a scene from a real or imagined production

213DE07A27DC49B8A20B766E439B0B06.description: Create an organizational plan (e.g., properties table, pre-set, stage left, stage right) for managing properties backstage during a real or imagined production.

BD1A849675AC4604BE2F88EA5037EF20.description: Describe the purpose and procedures for tasks carried out by stage managers, such as: taking notes during meetings; scheduling planning, rehearsals and production; co-ordinating with production department heads; maintaining blocking notes; creating, revising and distributing call sheets; coordinating set up and strike; and, calling the show.

8B8DA0588F374DC793BF9B810AEFCD70.description: Discuss ways that stage managers organize and manage production time, tasks and resources.

401748CC94A54A22B433F92A70F6794C.description: Explain the importance of the planning phase of a theatre production.

FF4EF9CF22CD4B979B5F677F854344A2.description: Research stage manager responsibilities such as: carrying out main administrative duties for the production; scheduling and organizing (e.g., fittings and rehearsals); communicating director’s instructions to crew members; and, organizing backstage activity during the show.

69E0224B0FA64D00BA5B41A03A0F4342.description: Describe the role of a stage manager.

7E73A99D0F40414EBF2556E8C7D81B44.description: Examine the role and responsibilities of a stage manager.

11BD4F7CBC624848830329E88DBEAD9B.description: Identify and practise safety precautions and procedures when working with projection equipment.

783E0AEC5E0D47F0B2BCFE0087B0FD92.description: Create an inspirational ideas bank of designs that use projections for various purposes.

D983FC2D9F9E43B0BF86D6A27DA1B4BE.description: Experiment with the creation and refinement of projections (e.g., replacing constructed set design items with still images, comparing presentation software, trying short-throw lens, projecting moving images, adjusting theater lighting, avoiding unwanted shadows, playing with fades and transitions).

A99F293F1A5B49328A4B2C29140A4765.description: Investigate different ways to create projections considering technical specifications and factors such as the projectors’ lumens, throw distance, throw ratio, physics of light, intensity of light and direction.

B4D602F775364D15A8B1546BD2177BEE.description: Explore ways that projections (e.g., front versus rear, slideshow software, animation and other video, shadow play) can be created and used in theatre.

EA172422AC7744669DB6E8502614337E.description: Discuss projection design processes (e.g., researching, storyboarding, acquiring images or footage, editing, installing, controlling).

45D1F6AD9DA14697924FA2D9417CB926.description: Investigate the functions of projection design and use of projection systems and technologies.

9DF088D7E1744C7B8DF7D8894A9E283F.description: Apply technical skills to create stage projections that incorporate projection design.

CC8D8E08819B448E9352EF6794EB048F.description: Create an inspirational sound bank of designs that demonstrate selected functions of sound in theatre.

8B4B99A469724DFA8C065421650ED34D.description: Identify and practise safety precautions and procedures when working with stage sound and video.

D6AF15CE1F3D4885BB96E0EB9312E660.description: Discuss and examine ways of organizing sound (e.g., plot, cue sheets) for stage productions or events.

CCCA9705E2F149FD931FA5207FCE5D2B.description: Create and find sources for sound effects.

4435305F58384CF8BB9199D6AD9A6EF6.description: Research and explore fundamentals of stage sound and video in theatre.

468106C34B454AE1A1CD43D612AE6650.description: Experiment with basic recording and playback sound systems, including analog and digital systems, and explore controllable properties such as pitch, volume, quality, direction and duration.

815D25AD8FB54637841EDED79DA2F52E.description: Discuss functions of sound design, such as: helping to establish time or location; transitioning between scenes; creating or changing the mood; increasing suspense; and, enhancing characters’ qualities.

CD97B585EACE4489B0674D96ADE0F3FF.description: Investigate artistic and technical approaches used in sound design.

9131953F8F30445DBB0DC5F073EAD9A2.description: Create an inspirational image bank of designs that demonstrate selected functions of lighting in theatre.

4EA27708C48D4020BBC1DC72CAFCC9EB.description: Identify and practise safety precautions and procedures for stage lighting.

8D437F7CC7504CF6BB3D2BA154D1CDE4.description: Demonstrate how to hang, aim, focus and gel lighting instruments.

D0058868BC20461FA2A6C04C1EF9FBE9.description: Demonstrate the operation of a lighting control system (e.g., followspotting).

1E387B5820904B0ABDCEF9DAEB64CE23.description: Examine procedures for operating and maintaining lighting equipment.

27C9EE3558D04C29A3DF0F751760C211.description: Examine the basics of colour and light theory (e.g., the colour spectrum, colour and hue, values and intensity of colour, warm and cool colours, distribution of light, movement of light, psychology of colour).

CDE6424BB4024AD9BC68A27364AB58AE.description: Examine the functions of lighting such as to: ensuring visibility; establishing a scene; creating a mood; sculpting; focusing the audience’s attention; composing visual pictures; stylizing; staging the story; and, creating rhythm.

3F4A802CAB7047ED96A722DEAA01A7AB.description: Investigate artistic and technical approaches used in stage lighting.

13C64A3AE5F447A18C4F8FD633C58F64.description: Recognize the importance of clear communication during theatre production meetings.

5D5A82693E24498B9E90D37EBC9CE8E9.description: Design and create hair and makeup to support a specific character in collaboration with the costume designer.

D5630DDE58F9408A9627B3CF28DB8A04.description: Demonstrate correct hygiene, sanitation and principles of safety while working with stage hair and makeup tools and products.

EA2E9995E5E74959849C3EEAD18A77B9.description: Experiment with basic stage makeup for selected functions.

AAB50FA922DE42EDAEC8614D772C53C2.description: Research and identify tools and materials used in hair and makeup design and production.

6DB043F54F42449487A7BC653FBE707A.description: Create an inspirational image bank of designs that demonstrate selected functions of hair and makeup in theatre.

6D7B000BAE564E6983B8CD481152EB28.description: Develop a list of guidelines for safely selecting, applying, removing and storing makeup and hair products.

A8ED0A1F4FCD41B48538C5D2E6B9F095.description: Discuss the importance of sanitation and hygiene as they relate to hair and makeup in theatre.

43F158C2DA444782A13801030FA43FBC.description: Examine functions of makeup and hair in productions such as: creating and communicating information (e.g., personality, socioeconomic background, era, setting, style, situation of role) about the characters; supporting visibility of actor; and, enhancing, altering or maintaining the appearance of an actor.

9C68B9E43F0E41D7AC3D1B4296237260.description: Apply fundamentals of makeup and hair design in theatre productions.

A4D41654FB824581AC93A294411DAB30.description: Identify and practise the principles of theatre safety as they relate to costume design.

F0F97DA2B22546E79887004F87DEB41D.description: Create preliminary rough sketches for costumes for a specific scene or act, real or imagined.

59A5C82203A945648831C4A89A3AAD12.description: Experiment with the design and rendering of costumes (e.g., drawing, making a collage, using interactive apps, sketching silhouettes) for specific characters.

89D647347CB046A482D4D6795842394D.description: Examine strategies for identifying protocols and processes concerning the use of culturally-sacred items in costume design.

9A222619200D413599B4537EAF814813.description: Differentiate between costumes and culturally-significant clothing such as regalia, saris and kilts.

F72B557914BE4E7E8331B6B0487BB531.description: Discuss the role of cultural appreciation in costume design.

EEAEA04C05DD4C82B7EF5AAFC64BF29B.description: Examine the process of costume design (e.g., analyzing both text and fabric source material, creating a costume plot, working with director and other designers, creating renderings, draping, construction).

EA042FF02FFB4D59B4C2299AF937C384.description: Brainstorm different ways to create costumes considering factors such as available resources, skill level, safety, mobility and quick changes.

5E9D423CD0D74EDABA86D7EBB8173264.description: Create an inspirational image bank of designs that demonstrate different functions of costumes.

0AA055188AFA480D91F4EB2D26E238A1.description: Describe the role of costume designer in the planning and production stages of theatre.

9086B8ED6CC74BAA85C4E9FAE93402D3.description: Examine functions of costumes and costume design such as: representing the mood, style and time period of the production; reinforcing and enhancing actors’ characters or changing appearances; distinguishing between characters and suggesting relationships; suggesting change in character development and age; and, supporting overall artistic mood and style.

A9727342496C473FBA31E7EECAC1FF0C.description: Investigate artistic and technical approaches used in costume design.

200D838A6B89462F9982A7ABD45E9551.description: Create the proposed scenic art project by hand or with the aid of technology.

997FB411DA224D5781797A5FA6726C4C.description: Review safety precautions and practices related to producing scenic art.

85A3D4F22E59408181A33827C5FE067A.description: Propose a scenic art project (e.g., backdrop, throne, flat piece of scenery, the illusion of a three-dimensional object on a two-dimensional surface).

34910D5B15D84C2F8F23B27174B6A461.description: Demonstrate problem-solving strategies when creating illusions.

1FC2259FB517486ABE9FD93004D0CC35.description: Demonstrate the use of perspective when drawing thumbnail sketches for backdrops.

6BD11AF65F9042CC9B7A5F8D58D7D371.description: Experiment with painting techniques (e.g., scumbling, stippling, spattering, lining) to create a variety of surface textures.

B00D2F2FB98543D18D982852AC7C252C.description: Create new colours and textures for set pieces by mixing paint.

C962498FFB404795876D04505F391CFE.description: Create an inspirational image bank of designs that demonstrate different functions (e.g., bringing the set designer’s vision to life; creating texture; painting backdrops; using faux to create perspective; creating illusion of space, time and place) of scenic art in theatre.

CC40906F85F341ECA24A3E373BDA5BA5.description: Explain the role and specific tasks of scenic artists and painters (e.g., scenic artist interprets the scenic designer’s renderings and paints featured artwork such as wallpaper, backdrops, wood grain, marble or trompe l’oeil whereas a painter lays in colour).

344282BA6614493686C3535B309ADE69.description: Experiment with scenic art materials to create a piece of scenic art.

83231ABBD41F4F61ACBB334B4590288B.description: Identify and practise safety precautions (e.g., ensuring platforms meet structural strength standards, using non-combustive materials) required for set construction in a shop and stage setting.

785A1C4FDB6B49D992C369416AECF675.description: Create a two-dimensional (e.g., backdrop, basic 4x8 flat) or three- dimensional (e.g., bush, rock) piece of scenery.

7C401A1FD48A47DFB26B4062F565F03E.description: Problem-solve ways to identify and simplify construction materials and techniques (e.g., suggestions of walls and windows rather than building the real thing).

52F3278EA1C34EE88E9186203A32731A.description: Create drawings for the construction of one or more two- or three- dimensional scenery pieces.

3B900E4DC9C44605B75F07C1CC555DDA.description: Create an inspirational image bank of theatre set and scenery pieces that demonstrate construction practices considering a variety of factors such as portability, safety, illusion of reality or imagined environments.

68FE0E29D6614A5EB869B2D10BB3C2C5.description: Demonstrate understanding of set construction and set piece terminology such as: flats (e.g., zipper, book, unit set pieces); sandbagging; jacks; fasteners; masking; and, revolves.

8F4D0B82E8E041DDB153102E4530294A.description: Investigate how set construction is different from traditional building construction.

DE1BD9AA09DB4F119ABFD8310CBD2252.description: Examine the specific responsibilities of the head carpenter and construction team related to the realization of scenic design concepts.

B567106552824F1B88F9E60319FABE7B.description: Review the roles of the technical director, production manager, scenic artist and other team members as they relate to set construction.

501CEFEB8BB9487EA2D686D0E74315EC.description: Investigate artistic and technical approaches used in set construction.

C2A391D4847244ABB809A86EDF596AA5.description: Practise safety precautions and procedures when working with stage properties in theatre.

D5D2A9BEC204483AA00C466C6C4CC669.description: Collaborate on a plan to organize the properties for one or more acts of a play that is real or imagined.

E04EA890E3314A399AF30E6F8F7CCC4F.description: Identify reasons why properties must be organized backstage.

35B1BBE13F58479D854EDFF3270850AA.description: Plan for the acquisition, organization and management of properties considering factors such as: borrowing, transforming and creating; making and taking inventory; handling donations including care, return and acknowledgement; meeting other demands of the play; organizing properties tables, template(s) and storage; maintaining and repairing properties; delivering and returning properties to and from actors; and, pre- and post-production responsibilities.

356F39029D1B4E1896DF54FC071FC7A4.description: Brainstorm and propose solutions to potential problems and situations that might occur in regard to properties.

9701756B456D4E90B7B8A885DF4DEBF4.description: Design and create a three-dimensional property based on inspiration materials (e.g., photos, drawings, renderings) for a real or imagined production.

B032F966DB8840638BB728E4FC80E91B.description: Discuss how property designers must consider factors such as: demands of the play; budgetary limitations; believability; and, practicality.

7D735B07FE0948A3A22F196C29175201.description: Create an image bank (e.g., digital, print) to use as inspiration for different categories of properties.

5E19A308992B45B0A8C5D36942CD3052.description: Categorize a variety of stage properties such as food, magazines, weapons, signs, puppets, money, campfires, imaginary creatures and masks.

2371C7D6705A48FDB8E03E347C702319.description: Brainstorm ways (e.g., hand/action, background, breakaway, consumable/perishable, dress, dummy, rehearsal, set, static, stunt) of categorizing stage properties.

9DE068712C054D2D8F598937ABEB5EB7.description: Define ‘stage properties’ and discuss their purpose in a production.

D52A986C15A14B299BBBE8A25C25D85B.description: Apply methods of categorizing and creating stage properties.

E000EB8DBF4B41958CD78E6CB8856AF3.description: Reflect on personal successes and challenges experienced during design and creation of a real or imagined performance space.

9FD2A33A078B460BA1A2E261254EAACD.description: Design and create a model (e.g., shoebox), in relative scale, of a real or imagined performance space for one style of set (e.g., realistic, suggested, period, abstract, digitally created).

FF99C798A12B400DBB5D7248736F8ABE.description: Investigate the purpose (e.g., artistic, functional) of a set model.

354F136B7BC9454E9EB695FC7BB69995.description: Create a basic floor plan using relative scale.

340EF4C9AB534593B3877F374A1E0F42.description: Render a simple stage design considering factors such as the design scheme and scale for that space.

A92C7AB2CF2F42E3B1E9B54F6F982AC5.description: Examine the stage and/or set requirements of a selected play or scene and propose ways to create the environment.

D876DC7E47FC49B09959AA9693B76682.description: Examine strategies for identifying protocols and processes concerning the representation or use of culturally-sacred items in set design.

BDADB66EA7B14364B085170F353BC143.description: Discuss the importance of researching and honouring the cultural significance of items (e.g., art, furniture, symbols) before incorporating them into set design.

0000114E002D42F5A1073C68BB9CC7CB.description: Explore ways that a set design can be rendered using hand skills and digital technologies.

08879634D41F4BBCA530CB8D075259BF.description: Research and examine the creation of illusions (e.g., projections, transformational set pieces, revolves).

CEDE42A25B0D4B94BB090DEA45990222.description: Explain and reflect on how sets can create environments for dramatic work (e.g., realistic versus suggested set).

C94DF9BBCA494553BCF1FFB07CB6B1C9.description: Research various types of theatre sets such as: realistic (e.g., construct box set); suggested (e.g., outdoor, street or forest scene); period (e.g., Greek, Medieval, Elizabethan, Restoration, Modern); abstract (e.g., symbolic use of a ladder to represent a house); and, digitally created.

D7AD259F1BC14FA59758B8CFAB43803E.description: Examine the function of a set designer.

0F460D50C75D44D49828A5A4CCFF806E.description: Investigate artistic and technical approaches used in set design.

91A93397164948BB97C0CF4CF22C5E66.description: Co-construct a list of safety rules for general stage use (e.g., wearing closetoed shoes, no drinks on stage, procedures for using machines and stage devices).

18603A76FFE343578F24B1AB7FA49247.description: Investigate safety protocols and guidelines from theatre spaces similar to the school or community playing space.

D1488AB032304938B0A7AE45712640FB.description: Research various safety codes (e.g., Canadian Electrical Code) and guidelines used in theatre including their purposes and related procedures.

8FDEA92898AD41598951C6A378E5231B.description: Discuss the purpose, scope and application of Safety Data Sheets in the theatre environment.

377266D8174B42BA8A021A463287668C.description: Research Occupational Health and Safety regulations that apply to school, community and professional theatre facilities as they pertain to the use of items/features such as steps, risers, ladders, handrails on risers, rigging and traps in stage floor).

7F8A8693C34C479696EEEA97744BCCBD.description: Examine how safety standards are specific to each area of technical theatre (e.g., electrics, set construction, chemicals, overhead rigging, paints and glues, pyrotechnics, power tools, stage machinery).

8B1F534894424CADB3B3E4F04CB598D8.description: Describe basic safety procedures used in performance spaces and theatre environments for a variety of tasks such as working with rigging or lighting and working in darkness or at heights.

5D9ADCB40D8F46169437274D37B2E6B5.description: Identify risks, potential safety hazards and procedures used to ensure safety in theatre environments.

3071B61628F5410F92D048199255BF2E.description: Discuss employers’ and employees’ rights and responsibilities pertaining to workplace hazards and how they can work together to prevent workplace hazards in the theatre.

75B84B82EAFC438D8F6F38C0409F9ECC.description: Examine and apply basic safety standards in theatre arts work and performance spaces.

46BBCC481A394B9FA2C2C67177E70F21.description: Safety in the Theatre – Rights and Responsibilities (Core)

55854F0758DC435F8DDFB9CA6D696F1C.description: Examine how digital technologies could be used in selected performance spaces.

301A67805EC94C8A845FD597E5624FE8.description: Recognize the effect the theatre location such as outdoor, theatre in the round, site-specific or historical theatre has on the audience.

95E34B928B224BBEA3B5F6CF50602F99.description: Explore opportunities and challenges for a production team related to a selected performance space (e.g., potential interior and exterior performance areas and stages in the school or community) and discuss innovative options.

F8A2BD960FFC4D1ABB43ED9F98B588EB.description: Discuss how theatre professionals plan for adaptability to adjust for performance limitations (e.g., space, time parameters).

F63D6844F71F4C5EA981006E8462B3DB.description: Identify features of the stage, house and backstage areas of a school, community or professional theatre facility.

DBC7E81DE9164320A52953F10F880F3D.description: Investigate technical theatre practices of selected world cultures (e.g., Japanese Kabuki makeup, Greek masks, Indonesian gamelan music sound design and shadow puppet theatre).

2541E5140C1245A6AC442257FC2C7F74.description: Research performance spaces of a variety of traditions (e.g., forum theatre, environmental theatre, theatre that moves from venue to venue, First Nations longhouse).

F6C9D7983A8D451DBCAA3B7D2E7204B4.description: Research and examine examples of Canadian Indigenous theatre staging considering performance spaces and technical theatre examples (e.g., use of symbolism and imagery, masks, wardrobe, lighting, sound, music, dance, properties, scenic design).

3AC0ED2DC39B444292E76AC25642B3AA.description: Differentiate between working parts of a stage and scenery.

9C8BFB391EC244F995F26DB98E93A9C4.description: Discuss Western theatre stage terms (e.g., front of house, apron, arena, backstage, down stage, flexible theatre, in the round, onstage, off stage, proscenium, stage left, stage right, thrust stage, upstage, wings) in the context of a variety of performance spaces.

C06BA5A14553484F88DB1966A6B89D0F.description: Identify common areas (e.g., booth, fly gallery, catwalk) and aspects (e.g., curtaining system, grid and lighting system) of a traditional Western theatre performance space.

69148125304D4B12BCA6CFAEB0947B50.description: Investigate and compare the advantages and disadvantages of various indoor and outdoor performance spaces (e.g., arena/in the round, thrust, proscenium, black box, environmental).

1117E594A7184115BDC418501D7A986F.description: Assess performance spaces including those in the school and community,

2C387C022A2C42ABB2A84676BDDFC86B.description: Examine how artistic desires have created technological innovations (e.g., Cirque du Soleil using aerospace engineers to solve artistic problems).

6F4805E5F6B54454AB354085D34AF57F.description: Discuss challenges of early theatrical performances that didn’t have access to technology.

13343D0D5FD8415CBDC03B779792F99C.description: Explore the role of technical teams when working with collaboratively-devised theatrical performances.

4119C52184D643FB9FEF49A7839AB4BD.description: Examine the effects of theatrical or playing space locations, architectures and stage configurations (e.g., outdoor, in the round, sitespecific, thrust stages, arena stages, black-box, platform, shoebox) on audiences and consider how these diverse contexts impact technical theatre practices.

BD774100D45743398AF5C99066723DA3.description: Conduct an inquiry into technical theatre practices, such as those used in: French restoration theatre (e.g., naval battles, spectacle); different kinds of early staging (e.g., acoustics of amphitheaters); East Indian theatre and dance; Japanese Kabuki theatre; bear fights in English theatre; mask making; Italian theatre; outdoor theatre spaces; and, storytelling venues.

DF36A0F55C6749FD9B2780AD1C840C32.description: Apply ideas, inspired by the history of technical theatre, to own work (e.g., surrealist set, 1940s costumes and hair, Greek or Italian masks, live sound effects).

BBE67B2A52D84BDE8CB0DD8C8D3BF3B1.description: Experiment with elements of technical theatre (e.g., world theatre, Western) using design practices such as thumbnail sketches, renderings and/or models.

D732340892F74585B0EFED34995FE0FB.description: Examine technical theatre practices from the 1800s (e.g., early special effects, wind machines, waves, elevator stages).

4DB8445B4FAC43E7BFB89CD8D95037C7.description: Research early technical theatre including conventions (e.g., historic play formats, cultural traditions) and evolution of stage machinery (e.g., engineers such as Adolphe Appia, moveable scenery, flying machines, hydraulic stages, traps).

916082EB080A4DDE9ADA3EF09EC65880.description: Conduct an inquiry into the history and evolution of technical theatre design, exploring questions such as: How do theatre artists and companies create other worlds on stage?,What lighting was used in spaces and theatres before the advent of electricity?

33AD4B6BA7FF4929BACEFEBD44FEDD68.description: Discuss purposes of technical theatre design (e.g., set, properties, lighting, sound, costume, hair and makeup) including creative functions and practical considerations.

E4135DC4FFA44D5CB7FAD9EB41293BBF.description: Investigate the history and evolution of technical theatre design practices.

F7ACA4A7713C4EC1AB1B1B20382E23E2.description: Examine and experiment with selected traditional world theatre conventions (e.g., design a piece related to a specific theatre arts context)

05374AAABA024E5FBB11C7E789FE2E46.description: Reflect on the impact of design decisions on an audience.

C1959FD61F474634BC0228458DD7DA61.description: Demonstrate willingness to take creative risks, understand that not all ideas will be realized and recognize the value of learning through failure.

F570151E2B9A404AABDA3D80DCAA542C.description: Use the language of theatre purposefully.

C32AF9B8B7DC43C69D528847F0E96EFB.description: Create a production plan, budget and timeline, and identify roles for a real or imagined (e.g., paper or digital project) production.

6EB1DBBC14D5448190328EA77216A16A.description: Change the point of view of a scene or dramatic work by amplifying a technical or artistic component (e.g., incorporate audience interaction, replace an actor with an object or technical feature, project digital images on moving actors, use social media conventions in performance).

F65067B517B94BBDB32BD8A5FCA93CD3.description: Use a technical design component (e.g., light, costume, sound, digital technologies) for symbolic purposes as a mode for communicating ideas.

6DD15F1EFF5448FA9AA3554BEB325943.description: Interpret a scene through innovative use of various theatrical toolboxes (e.g., director’s, lighting designer’s, scenic designer’s, costume designer’s).

89F64B444D5F47D294F61819C2FD449C.description: Discuss purposes of a paper tech wherein designers meet with the stage manager to discuss and notate costume changes, light and sound transitions and other technical elements

5308AAFBE44D4AE9941F35D081FAFE1F.description: Use communication tools (e.g., language, maquettes, pictures, visual storyboard) to convey design ideas (e.g., mood, environment, symbolism).

0F2175116C8E4B73A889E788346F2F1B.description: Analyze scenes to generate design ideas and determine technical requirements.

9EEDCBCC19594876B04B47BD6AD3064A.description: Explore and apply components of a designer’s toolbox (e.g., visual skills, use of maquettes, representation of mood, use of symbol/metaphor, light, colour, sound) for aesthetic purposes.

3C1F3558FBB34968B856AF002DEB9B9A.description: Investigate the purposes and content of various theatrical toolboxes or toolkits (e.g., lighting designer’s, costume designer’s).

4B37D42A7FBB4D8C93A408274E42B3F5.description: Discuss functions of design areas (e.g., lighting to establish time, sound to reveal mood, set to establish place, costume to reveal character).

ABBF3E6B96D340FC8628C0BF4F1395E3.description: Examine the roles of individuals and teams in production design

D133F442D8AC4631B47D1E41DAD2E179.description: Investigate ways that designers (e.g., set, costume, lighting, sound) get their ideas (e.g., identifying play requirements, researching, discussing with director).

B98569E0D94B422E97568ACAF3742B5C.description: Examine the collaborative nature of theatre

D9EB06FA4BB146128901EF73995E4770.description: Investigate how designers create and collaborate to bring a theatrical vision to life.

7E706169962140E6B51637DEFE6F5209.description: Collaborative Processes of Theatrical Design and Production (Core)

689F88FD77874FAC845A4D485FE9CA42.description: Discuss similarities and differences between large and small theatre companies, considering the impact of the availability of resources (e.g., human and financial) on production.

FCA8FCD13356441BA1141C977293FB88.description: Investigate how theatres are funded (e.g., commercial, not-for-profit) and discuss the roles of producers and management teams in moving productions from inception to performance (e.g., licensing, budgeting, assembling creative and technical teams).

338FD3C18B8E4A9F87DD22354CAD5E94.description: Describe the relationships among department heads and theatre crews.

CDACD3DF1CCC4A0EB50E9509004EFC67.description: Identify and explore the responsibilities of production department heads.

841C1C33302C44C0B8F00B5E696F256F.description: Organize and maintain a learning log (i.e., theatre log) including items such as tasks, schedules, experiences and understandings, to support planning, self-reflection, documentation and evaluation of learning.

0B422424B1424B0DB5A2C3DEC2574D26.description: Create a visual representation (e.g., flowchart, map) to demonstrate relationships and interdependence among various theatre jobs

EEC31F8C23F240848FA2E271CE3CAC88.description: Identify and categorize team member responsibilities, discuss the collaborative nature of theatre production and co-develop school-based ‘company’ rules and procedures.

A0B3B351446D400EA1003A613ADA1B03.description: Research and discuss the roles of various permanent and contracted positions on a production team, such as: director; general manager; company manager; publicity personnel; front of house staff; stage and production managers; running crew; set and costume designers; technical director; and, light, sound, costume and makeup crews

25E9D481E51A46A39E796F78BD118B6F.description: Discuss the functions of theatre production teams (e.g., to bring artistic vision to life, to ensure production tasks are carried out in an aesthetically satisfying, safe, timely and cost-effective manner).

42B34148224B4AC9AA05E313ECE6207C.description: Generate and examine inquiry questions regarding the perceived value of theatre, such as: What makes theatre unique?, Why do audiences continue to attend theatre after many hundreds of years?, What do theatre production teams contribute to an audience’s experience?

542B7DC83DB048A1977AFDF328D6476D.description: Discuss the functions of theatre such as theatre that entertains, informs, documents, challenges and inspires.

1490E328F61A4923B95FFB7CAB66B7FE.description: Investigate the roles and responsibilities of theatre production team members.
